instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, intermittent green light
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board, replaced <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> and surrounding components. All measurements as they should be. Checked unwire circuit and PP3V42, <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_AOK</SIGNAL> are present. Power draw on PSU 0.019 - 0.025.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.6V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 12.6V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 12.6V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 16.09 - 16.13 fluctuating (0L to ground at <CAPACITOR>C7031</CAPACITOR>)
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.39 - 3.44V fluctuating
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.80 - 4.65, occasionally 5V, fluctuating constantly.

200K-ohm to ground on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>. Before I start injecting I feel like I'm missing something... Any feedback appreciated :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, intermittent green light
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, intermittent green light
threads.message: Fount a broken trace above <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>. Restored it and unit is now powering on. This can be marked as solved, thanks Duke.
